title: 107_s903
content:
The "Cache la Poudre River Corridor Technical Amendments Act of 2001" amends the Cache La Poudre River Corridor Act by changing references from Larimer County to Weld County. It also establishes the Cache La Poudre River Corridor Commission. The Cache La Poudre River Corridor Act is amended to establish the Cache La Poudre Corridor Commission and make technical amendments regarding recognition criteria. The Cache La Poudre River Corridor Act is amended to establish the Cache La Poudre Corridor Commission with 3 members from Larimer County or Weld County appointed by the Secretary from a list recommended by the Governor, representing the State, Colorado State University, and the Northern Colorado Water Conservancy District. The Cache La Poudre River Corridor Act is amended to establish the Cache La Poudre Corridor Commission with 3 members from Larimer County or Weld County appointed by the Secretary from a list recommended by the Governor. The members should be knowledgeable in the interests of Larimer County, with at least one having expertise in agriculture. The Cache La Poudre River Corridor Act is amended to establish the Cache La Poudre Corridor Commission with members from Larimer County and Weld County. Members must be knowledgeable in county interests, with expertise in agriculture or irrigated water. The Cache La Poudre River Corridor Act is amended to establish the Cache La Poudre Corridor Commission with members appointed by the Secretary from a list recommended by the Governor. The Commission members must have expertise in agriculture or irrigated water. The Cache La Poudre River Corridor Act is amended to establish the Cache La Poudre Corridor Commission with government employees subject to the Ethics in Government Act. Initial members of the Commission will serve 3-year terms. The Cache La Poudre Corridor Commission members will serve for either a 3-year term or a 2-year term, with specific appointments outlined in the legislation. The initial members appointed under specific paragraphs will serve for 1-year terms. The initial members appointed under specific paragraphs will serve for 1-year terms, including 1 member appointed under paragraph (1)(A)(iv)(III), 1 member appointed under paragraph (1)(A)(iv)(IV), and 1 member appointed under paragraph (1)(A)(v). SEC. 4. DUTIES OF COMMISSION.

The Commission is responsible for preparing, obtaining approval for, implementing, and supporting the Plan, administering the Corridor, and carrying out all other duties under this Act.

SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

The amendment authorizes appropriations for the Cache La Poudre River Corridor Act under the Cache la Poudre River Corridor Technical Amendments Act of 2001.
